lexUnit.name: dribble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a liquid) fall slowly in drops or a thin stream

sentence.text: Instead it stood staring bemusedly at its assailants while blood dribbled from its jaws onto the grass .
Her stabbing nails had torn his left upper eyelid and blood from the wound dribbled down the side of his face , some of it running across the orb itself , turning one half of his world crimson .
Blood dribbled from his nostrils .
His gob of saliva dribbled down then clung , warping the image of the turtle head as though the corresponding section of the enemy Titan was bubbling , rheum leaking from its right eye .
The vagrant follows us in , grinning toothlessly at Larry , saliva dribbling from his purple lips .
Close the vent as soon as water starts to dribble out , and check that the feed-and-expansion tank still has water in it after the radiator has been topped up .
Nor was there blood ; only a fluid the colour of brackish water , that dribbled from the wounds and ran across the table .
The butter was dribbling across that huge mark on his cheek .
The drizzle fell steadily , dribbling across the pock-marked tarmac , forcing forlorn figures at bus-stops to huddle together even closer under the shelters .
A sticky , pus-like fluid dribbled from the corners of both his eyes .
A spillage of lurid neon light , yellow and orange , dribbled from the windowsill to the floor .
Thus we are accumulating in our local rubbish dumps tons of baby excreta , some of it infected , which sooner or later will dribble into our water supply .
The tears dribbled on her face and made bright lines across the greyness of her cheeks and then her head was lost in her hands .
All the poetry had dribbled out of her .
The rain dribbled down Millet 's socks .
He paused , the butt of his cigar held against his brow , so that a cataract of white spume dribbled down into his eye socket .
Rainwater dribbled down her temples and the back of her neck .
The food dribbled out and she had to scoop it off his chin and shove it back in .
He scanned the newsprint greedily while his teeth sank into the bacon sandwich , the melted margarine dribbling over his fingers .
She felt the blouse stick to her back as the sweat began to dribble .
